messages.subject: Re: Friends on vacation
messages.msgSnippet: ... visiting grand parents, which we do every year.  My kids have asked if I will try to find them some kids to visit/play with while we are there.  Anyone
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Cameron Parham
<acsp2205@...> wrote:
>
> We will be visiting Greenville, NC from Aug 22-Sept 17. We will be
visiting grand parents, which we do every year. My kids have asked if
I will try to find them some kids to visit/play with while we are
there. Anyone know some friendly people there? I lived there for 20
years, but that was 1970-1990. I don't know anyone there with kids
anymore. I am 47, and the friends whom I stayed in touch with have
grown-up kids. My kids are 8(b), 10(g), and 13(b). Like most
homeschooled kids they are used to socializing with people of all ages
and both genders. Hope to hear from someone. Thanks!
>
> Cameron, from Havre, MT
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>


You realize the Live and Learn conference will be taking place during
that time over in Black Mountain NC? I know there is a strong
unschooling group in Asheville, I imagine there are some over in
Greenville. We're just over the mountains in TN if you feel like
traveling some more.:)

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Friends on vacation
messages.msgSnippet: We will be visiting Greenville, NC from Aug 22-Sept 17.  We will be visiting grand parents, which we do every year.  My kids have asked if I will try to find
messages.messageBody:
We will be visiting Greenville, NC from Aug 22-Sept 17. We will be visiting grand parents, which we do every year. My kids have asked if I will try to find them some kids to visit/play with while we are there. Anyone know some friendly people there? I lived there for 20 years, but that was 1970-1990. I don't know anyone there with kids anymore. I am 47, and the friends whom I stayed in touch with have grown-up kids. My kids are 8(b), 10(g), and 13(b). Like most homeschooled kids they are used to socializing with people of all ages and both genders. Hope to hear from someone. Thanks!

Cameron, from Havre, MT

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
